paragraphs.zh-tw: 128年前，世上最後一個國家，廢除了奴隸制。53年前，馬丁．路得．金恩發表了他的演說：「我有一個夢想」。但此時，我們生活的世界，膚色仍不只帶來第一印象，更留下一個長遠的印記。
paragraphs.en: It has been 128 years since the last countryin the world abolished slavery and 53 years since Martin Luther King pronouncedhis "I Have A Dream" speech. But we still live in a world where the color of our skinnot only gives a first impression, but a lasting one that remains.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我出生在一個充滿色彩的家庭，我父親是女佣的兒子，從她身上，他遺傳了強烈的黑巧克力膚色。
paragraphs.en: I was born in a family full of colors. My father is the son of a maid from whom he inheritedan intense dark chocolate tone.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 後來我的祖父母收養了他。女當家，也就是我的祖母有著如瓷的皮膚，如棉絮的頭髮。
paragraphs.en: He was adopted by thosewho I know as my grandparents. The matriarch, my grandma, has a porcelain skin and cotton-like hair.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我祖父的膚色則是介於香草和草莓優格兩者之間，如同我的叔叔和堂弟。我的母親有著肉桂色的皮膚，而她的母親是土生土長的巴西人，膚色帶點榛果和蜂蜜的色調，她的父親則是咖啡牛奶膚色，只不過是咖啡較濃的那一種。
paragraphs.en: My grandpa was somewhere betweena vanilla and strawberry yogurt tone, like my uncle and my cousin. My mother is a cinnamon-skindaughter of a native Brazilian, with a pinch of hazel and honey, and a man [who is]a mix of coffee with milk, but with a lot of coffee.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我的母親有兩個姊妹，一個是烤花生的膚色。另一個也是收養的，比較偏米色一點，像是鬆餅。
paragraphs.en: She has two sisters. One in a toasted-peanut skin and the other, also adopted, more on the beige side, like a pancake.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 在這個家庭長大，膚色對我來說向來不重要。然而，一離開家，事情很快就不同了。
paragraphs.en: Growing up in this family, color was never important for me. Outside home, however,things were different soon.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 膚色有許多其他含義。我記得我的第一堂繪畫課混雜著一堆矛盾的感覺。
paragraphs.en: Color had many other meanings. I remember my firstdrawing lessons in school as a bunch of contradictory feelings.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 課堂令人興奮，能發揮創意。但是我始終無法理解，那唯一的肉色鉛筆。我也是血肉之軀，但我不是粉紅色的。
paragraphs.en: It was exciting and creative but I never understoodthe unique flesh-colored pencil. I was made of flesh but I wasn't pink.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我的皮膚是棕色的，但大家說我是黑人。我當時七歲，色彩在我的腦海一片混亂。
paragraphs.en: My skin was brown,and people said I was black. I was seven years oldwith a mess of colors in my head.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 之後，當我帶著堂弟去學校，我常常被認為是小保姆。當我在朋友的聚會上進廚房幫忙，大家會以為我是女佣。
paragraphs.en: Later, when I took my cousin to school, I was usually taken for the nanny. By helping in the kitchenat a friend's party, people thought I was the maid.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 甚至曾有人把我當成娼妓，只因為我和歐洲裔的朋友一起在沙灘上散步。有許多次，當我去上層階級的居所拜訪我祖母或朋友，有人請我不要使用主電梯。
paragraphs.en: I was even treated like a prostitute just because I was walking aloneon the beach with European friends. And many times, visiting my grandma or friendsin upper class buildings, I was invited not to usethe main elevator.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 因為，最終，帶著這樣的膚色和頭髮，我不可以屬於某些地方。某方面，我習慣，也接受了這事實的一部分。
paragraphs.en: Because in the end, with this color and this hair, I cannot belong to some places. In some way, I get to used to it and accept part of it.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 但我內心深處仍在纏繞掙扎。幾年後，我和一個西班牙人結婚，
paragraphs.en: However, something inside of mekeeps revolving and struggling. Years later I married a Spaniard.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 可不是隨便一個西班牙人，我選擇的他，膚色像是被曬傷的龍蝦。
paragraphs.en: But not any Spaniard. I chose one with the skin colorof a lobster when sunburnt.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 自此，新的問題來了，你們的小孩會是什麼顏色呢？你們大概也能體會，這是我最不煩惱的事。
paragraphs.en: Since then, a new questionstarted to chase me. What will be the color of your children? As you can understand,this is my last concern.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 但思慮及此，以我之前的背景，我的故事引導我成為攝影師，於是就有了 Humanae。
paragraphs.en: But thinking about it, with my previous background, my story led me to makemy personal exercise as a photographer. And that is how Humanae was born.

paragraphs.zh-tw: Humanae 旨在追求突顯我們的真實色彩，而非不精確的白色、紅色、黑色、黃色等各種族的標記顏色。這像是一個質疑我們社會常規的遊戲。
paragraphs.en: Humanae is a pursuitto highlight our true colors, rather than the untrue white, red, black or yellowassociated with race. It's a kind of game to question our codes.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 它從個人故事展開，推向全球的歷史。我在白色背景上拍攝人物，
paragraphs.en: It's a work in progressfrom a personal story to a global history. I portray the subjectsin a white background.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 然後在鼻子上選擇一個11像素的方塊用來塗滿背景。之後在 Pantone 色票上尋找相應的顏色。從我的家人和朋友開始，透過社群網路的公開召喚，越來越多的人加入這場探險。
paragraphs.en: Then I choose an 11-pixelsquare from the nose, paint the background, and look for the corresponding colorin the industrial palette, Pantone. I started with my family and friends, then more and more peoplejoined the adventure, thanks to public callscoming through the social media.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我認為網際網路是展現我作品的主要場所，因為我想用一個公開的概念去邀請每個人在電腦上及他們的腦海中按下「分享」鍵。這個雪球開始滾動。
paragraphs.en: I thought that the main spaceto show my work was the Internet because I want an open conceptthat invites everybody to push the share buttonin both the computer and their brain. The snowball started to roll.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 專案得到了極大的歡迎：邀請、展覽、實體形式、美術館和博物館等等，就這樣發生了。
paragraphs.en: The project had a great welcome -- invitations, exhibitions, physical formats, galleries and museums ... just happened.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 在這之中，我最喜愛的是：當 Humanae 佔據了公共空間，出現在大街上，它滋養了普及的討論，而且創造了社群的感覺。我拍攝了超過3000人，遍及13個國家，全球共19個不同的城市。
paragraphs.en: And among them, my favorite: when Humanae occupies public spaces and appears in the street, it fosters a popular debate and creates a feeling of community. I have portrayed more than 3,000 people in 13 different countries, 19 different cities around the world.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 攝影對象中，有人名列富比士排行榜，也有乘船穿越地中海的難民。可能來自巴黎的聯合國教科文組織總部或者難民營，
paragraphs.en: Just to mention some of them -- from someone included in the Forbes list, to refugees who crossedthe Mediterranean by boat. In Paris, from the UNESCOHeadquarters to a shelter.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 也有來自瑞士的學生，或是來自里約熱內盧的貧民區。各種信仰、性別身分、或是身障人士，新生兒或身患絕症的人。
paragraphs.en: And students both in Switzerlandand favelas in Rio de Janeiro. All kinds of beliefs, gender identities or physical impairments, a newborn or terminally ill.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們共同打造了Humanae。這些照片讓我們重新思考我們看待彼此的方式。
paragraphs.en: We all together build Humanae. Those portraits make us rethinkhow we see each other.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 當現代科學質疑著種族觀念，對我們來說，黑白黃紅究竟代表什麼？是眼睛、鼻子、嘴巴、頭髮嗎？或者是必須相關於出身、國籍、甚至是銀行帳戶？這個個人專案成為一場發現之旅。突然，我意識到Humanae 幫助了許多人。
paragraphs.en: When modern scienceis questioning the race concept, what does it mean for usto be black, white, yellow, red? Is it the eye, the nose,the mouth, the hair? Or does it have to do with our origin, nationality or bank account? This personal exerciseturned out to be a discovery. Suddenly I realized that Humanaewas useful for many people.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 它代表一種鏡子，反射那些無法從刻板印象的標籤中找到自我的人。神奇的是，人們開始和我分享他們對這個專案的想法。
paragraphs.en: It represents a sort of mirror for those who cannot findthemselves reflected in any label. It was amazing that people started to sharetheir thoughts about the work with me.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我收到數以百計的來信，我也將與你們分享。一個母親…一個11歲的女孩的母親寫信給我：「對我來說，這是提升孩子自信心的良好工具。上個禮拜，她的一個女性朋友與她爭執，說她不屬於，也不應被允許在挪威生活。
paragraphs.en: I have hundreds of that, I will share with you, too. A mother of 11 years -- A mother of an 11-year-old girl wrote me, "Very good for me as a toolto work on her confidence, as this past weekend one of her girlfriends argued with herthat she does not belong and should not be allowedto live in Norway.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 因此你的作品在我心裡有特別的地位。對我來說非常重要。」一位女士在臉書上分享她的照片，她寫道：「我一生，來自世界的人，很難把我歸類於某個族群、某個刻版印象，或是某個盒子裡。也許他們不該試圖將我歸類，
paragraphs.en: So your work hasa very special place in my heart and it's very important for me." A woman shared her portraiton Facebook and wrote, "All my life, people from across the globehad difficulties to place me in a group, a stereotype, a box. Perhaps we should stop.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 與其把人放入框架分類，不如問每個人：『你如何定義自己？』那麼，我會說：『嗨，我是瑪希爾。我是多明尼加裔荷蘭人，我在多元家庭中長大，而且我是個雙性戀的女性。』除了這些意外而感人的反應，Humanae也在各個不同領域有了新生。
paragraphs.en: Instead of framing, ask the individual, 'How would you label yourself?' Then I would say, 'Hi. I'm Massiel. I'm a Dominican-Dutch, I grew up in a mixed family and I'm a bisexual woman.' " Besides these unexpectedand touching reactions, Humanae finds a new lifein a different variety of fields.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 讓我舉其中的幾個例子。插畫家和藝術系學生參考它來做草圖和研究。這是個人臉面孔的集合。
paragraphs.en: Just to show you some examples, illustrators and art students using it as a referencefor their sketches and their studies. It's a collection of faces.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 各領域研究人員，包括人類學、物理學以及神經科學，利用Humanae進行科學研究：其中有人類種族、光生理學、面部識別，或是阿茲海默症的研究。當中最重要的影響是，Humanae被選為「外交事務雜誌」的封面這是最切題相關的一個政治出版物。
paragraphs.en: Researchers in the fields of anthropology, physics and neuroscience use Humanae with differentscientific approaches related to human ethnicity, optophysiology, face recognition or Alzheimer's. One of the most importantimpacts of the project is that Humanae was chosento be the cover of Foreign Affairs, one of the most relevantpolitical publications.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 當我們說到外交，我找到了這個專案的最佳大使…教師們。
paragraphs.en: And talking about foreign affairs, I found the perfectambassadors for my project ... teachers.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 有些老師把Humanae當做教材。他們的熱情鼓勵了我回到繪畫課上，但這次是以教師的角色。
paragraphs.en: They are the ones that use Humanaeas a tool for educational purposes. Their passion encourages meto go back to drawing classes, but this time as a teacher myself.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我的學生們，包括成人與兒童，畫出他們的自畫像，試著發現屬於他們的獨一無二色彩。身為攝影師，我瞭解到自己可以是人們溝通的管道。
paragraphs.en: My students, both adults and kids, paint their self-portraits, trying to discovertheir own unique color. As a photographer, I realize that I can be a channelfor others to communicate.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 做為我自己，做為安潔莉卡，每當我拍一張照片，我感覺自己正坐在心理治療師前面。所有的挫折、恐懼，和孤獨，那些我曾經感受的情緒，
paragraphs.en: As an individual, as Angélica, every time I take a picture, I feel that I am sittingin front of a therapist. All the frustration, fear and loneliness that I once felt ...

paragraphs.zh-tw: 都成了愛。最後一個國家…世界上最後一個廢除了奴隸制的國家。就是我的出生地：巴西。
paragraphs.en: becomes love. The last country -- the last country in the worldwho abolished slavery is the country where I was born, Brazil.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 為了消弭歧視，我們尚待努力。歧視在世界各處仍然普遍存在，而且不會自行消失。
paragraphs.en: We still have to work hardto abolish discrimination. That remains a common practice worldwide, and that will not disappear by itself.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 謝謝你們。(鼓掌)謝謝。
paragraphs.en: Thank you. Thank you.

title: Angelica Dass The Beauty Of Human Skin In Every Color
